description: IMTD requires additional resources to assist with the delivery and support of existing and upcoming projects leveraging various technologies. These resources will supplement existing staff to ensure that new and existing IM/IT projects adhere to the established project management and delivery processes that have been developed to provide for the efficient and effective management and delivery of IM/IT products or services to TBS clients.
full_summary:
**TBIPS – Multiple Resource Categories Solicitation**

**Reference Number**: PW-22-01013907
**Publication Date**: November 17, 2022
**Tender Closing Date**: December 9, 2022, 2:00 PM (14:00)

**Solicitation Overview**

The Treasury Board of Canada, acting as the Contracting Authority, is seeking qualified suppliers to provide Task-Based Informatics Professional Services (TBIPS) under multiple resource categories. The TBIPS contract is a repeat procurement process, whereby the contract is refreshed three times per year.

**Eligible Suppliers**

Only those TBIPS Supply Arrangement Holders who have qualified under Tier 1 for services in the National Capital Region (NCR) for the following categories are eligible to participate:

* B.1 Business Analyst - Level 3
* B.1 Business Analyst: User Experience (UX) Specialist - Level 3
* B.5 Business Process Re-Engineering (BPR) Consultant - Level 3
* B.7 Business Transformation Architect - Level 3

**Solicitation Requirements**

The purpose of this solicitation is to obtain services to support existing and upcoming projects leveraging various technologies. The contract duration is from December 23, 2022, to December 22, 2023. The estimated number of resources required is one (1) to two (2) per category, and the number may fluctuate based on operational requirements.

**Evaluation Criteria**

Evaluations will be conducted with fairness in accordance with the evaluation criteria and selection methodology defined in the Request for Proposal (RFP).

**Security Requirements**

The Common PS SRCL #34 applies, and the minimum corporate security required is Secret. The minimum proposed resources security required is also Secret.

**Contracting Authority**

For inquiries regarding this RFP requirement, please contact:

Robert Penwarden
Treasury Board of Canada
Phone: 343-543-6021
Email: Robert.Penwarden@tbs-sct.gc.ca
**Note**: Buy-and-Sell.GC.CA is not responsible for the distribution of solicitation documents.

**Request for Proposal Documents**

The RFP documents will be emailed directly from the Contracting Authority to the qualified Supply Arrangement Holders who are being invited to bid on this requirement.

Authorization has been granted to undertake a select tendering process for this requirement. The contract award will be made to the most advantageous proposal, as determined by the evaluation committee.
